thread.title: Plane stays ahead of dust storm in Arizona
thread.title_full: Plane stays ahead of dust storm in Arizona

author: eTN Editor
title: Plane stays ahead of dust storm in Arizona
text:
Plane stays ahead of dust storm in Arizona   
Sep 03, 2015 View of a plane landing at Sky Harbor during the dust storm   
A Blowing Dust Advisory has been issued for Arizona, US, meaning a dust storm is tracking through the area causing extremely poor visibility. 
Areas affected include parts of Scottsdale, Mesa, and Phoenix. This particular dust storm is fairly strong and well-organized. 
For those driving, the storms can sneak up quickly so it advisable to get off the road as quickly as possible. Drivers are advised to turn off their lights and take their feet off the brakes so they are not visible, otherwise other drivers may think they are driving on the road and will attempt to follow. 
Currently, the wall of dust is moving up I-10 and is about to cross L-202 Santan into Phoenix and Chandler.
